Classes, interfaces and traits

Forms¶

Forms is a class that controls the creation and management of HTML form elements.

The class can be tied in with other systems for creating of forms that can be generated by passing in dynamic elements. Example: ```php //Create Input Element echo Forms::creatInput('name', 'text'); //Create An Input with Bootstrap Element echo Forms::creatInput('name', 'text', array('class' => 'form-control')); //Complete Form echo Forms::formBegin('my-form', array('method' => 'post', 'enctype' => 'multipart/form-data')); echo Forms::creatInput('name', 'text', array('class' => 'form-control', 'value' => 'My Name', 'placeholder' => 'Enter your name')); echo Forms::button('enter', array('type' => 'submit', 'class' => 'btn btn-success')); echo formEnd(); ```
« More »

Html¶

HTML is a class designed for generating HTML elements to display to the user.

The class takes in basic HTML forms with options. The functionality can be used with dynamic form generation tools. Example: ```php //Create array of links $links = array('Google', 'http://www.google.com', 'Facebook', 'http://www.facebook.com'); $html = ''; $li = ''; foreach($links as $key => $value): $li .= Html::li(Html::ahref($key, $value)); endforeach; $html = Html::ul($li); $html = Html::div($html, array('class' => 'container')); echo $html; //The following will be printed <div class="container"> <ul> <li><a href="http://www.google.com">Google</a><li> <li><a href="http://www.facebook.com">Facebook</a><li> </ul> </div> ```
« More »
